recipe.title: Greek-Style Turkey Meatballs with Tzatziki
recipe.ingredient_list:
1 lb lean ground turkey
1/4 cup almond flour
1 egg
2 cloves garlic, minced
1 tsp dried oregano
1/2 tsp dried mint
1/4 cup finely chopped red onion
1/4 cup crumbled feta cheese
Salt and pepper to taste

For the tzatziki:
1 cup Greek yogurt
1/2 cucumber, grated and squeezed dry
1 clove garlic, minced
1 tbsp lemon juice
1 tbsp fresh dill, chopped
Salt to taste
recipe.instructions:
Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
In a large bowl, mix all meatball ingredients until well combined.
Form mixture into 20 meatballs and place on the prepared baking sheet.
Bake for 15-18 minutes, or until meatballs are cooked through (internal temperature of 165°F/74°C).
While meatballs are cooking, prepare tzatziki: Mix all tzatziki ingredients in a bowl.
Serve meatballs hot with tzatziki sauce for dipping.
recipe.allergen_information: Contains egg, dairy (feta and yogurt), and nuts (almond flour).
recipe.storage_information: Store meatballs and tzatziki separately in airtight containers in the refrigerator for up to 3 days. Reheat meatballs in microwave or oven.
recipe.tips:
Serve over a bed of mixed greens or with roasted vegetables for a complete meal.
For a lower-fat option, use ground turkey breast instead of regular ground turkey.
These meatballs can also be pan-fried in a non-stick skillet for about 3-4 minutes per side.

recipe.title: Vegan Buddha Bowl
recipe.ingredient_list:
1 cup quinoa, cooked
1/2 cup chickpeas, drained and rinsed
1/2 avocado, sliced
1/4 cup shredded carrots
1/4 cup chopped cucumber
1/4 cup red cabbage, thinly sliced
1 tbsp tahini
1 tbsp lemon juice
1 tbsp olive oil
Salt and pepper to taste
recipe.instructions:
Arrange quinoa, chickpeas, avocado, carrots, cucumber, and red cabbage in a bowl.
In a small bowl, whisk together tahini, lemon juice, olive oil, salt, and pepper.
Drizzle dressing over the bowl before serving.
recipe.storage_information: Store components separately in the refrigerator for up to 2 days. Assemble just before serving.
recipe.tips:
Add your favorite vegetables or swap quinoa for brown rice.
Top with nuts or seeds for added crunch.

recipe.title: Gluten-Free Chocolate Chip Cookies
recipe.ingredient_list:
1 cup gluten-free flour blend
1/2 tsp baking soda
1/4 tsp salt
1/2 cup butter, softened
1/2 cup brown sugar
1/4 cup granulated sugar
1 egg
1 tsp vanilla extract
1 cup chocolate chips
recipe.instructions:
Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
In a bowl, whisk together gluten-free flour, baking soda, and salt.
In another bowl, beat butter, brown sugar, and granulated sugar until creamy. Add egg and vanilla extract, beating until combined.
Gradually add dry ingredients to wet ingredients, mixing until just combined. Stir in chocolate chips.
Drop spoonfuls of dough onto the prepared baking sheet.
Bake for 10-12 minutes, until golden brown.
recipe.storage_information: Store in an airtight container at room temperature for up to 5 days.
recipe.tips:
Use a mix of dark and milk chocolate chips for added flavor.
Add a pinch of sea salt on top before baking for a salty-sweet combination.

recipe.title: Keto Avocado Egg Salad
recipe.ingredient_list:
4 hard-boiled eggs, chopped
1 avocado, diced
2 tbsp mayonnaise
1 tsp Dijon mustard
1 tbsp lemon juice
Salt and pepper to taste
Chopped chives for garnish
recipe.instructions:
In a bowl, mix chopped eggs, avocado, mayonnaise, Dijon mustard, and lemon juice.
Season with salt and pepper.
Garnish with chopped chives before serving.
recipe.storage_information: Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 2 days.
recipe.tips:
Serve on lettuce leaves or low-carb bread.
Add diced celery or red onion for extra crunch.

recipe.title: Paleo Beef and Broccoli
recipe.ingredient_list:
1 lb beef flank steak, thinly sliced
4 cups broccoli florets
2 tbsp coconut aminos
1 tbsp sesame oil
1 tbsp olive oil
2 cloves garlic, minced
1 tsp ginger, minced
Salt and pepper to taste
Sesame seeds for garnish
recipe.instructions:
In a skillet, heat olive oil over medium-high heat.
Add sliced beef and cook until browned. Remove from skillet and set aside.
In the same skillet, add sesame oil, garlic, and ginger, cooking until fragrant.
Add broccoli florets and stir-fry until tender-crisp.
Return beef to the skillet and add coconut aminos. Stir to combine and heat through.
Season with salt and pepper.
Garnish with sesame seeds before serving.
recipe.storage_information: Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 3 days. Reheat in a skillet over medium heat.
recipe.tips:
Serve over cauliflower rice for a complete meal.
Add other vegetables like bell peppers or carrots for variation.

recipe.title: Vegetarian Stuffed Peppers
recipe.ingredient_list:
4 bell peppers, tops removed and seeds cleaned
1 cup cooked quinoa
1 can black beans, drained and rinsed
1 cup corn kernels
1 cup diced tomatoes
1/2 cup shredded cheddar cheese
1 tsp cumin
1/2 tsp chili powder
Salt and pepper to taste
Chopped cilantro for garnish
recipe.instructions:
Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). Grease a baking dish.
In a bowl, mix cooked quinoa, black beans, corn, diced tomatoes, cumin, chili powder, salt, and pepper.
Stuff bell peppers with the quinoa mixture and place in the prepared baking dish.
Sprinkle shredded cheddar cheese on top of each stuffed pepper.
Bake for 25-30 minutes, until peppers are tender and cheese is melted.
Garnish with chopped cilantro before serving.
recipe.storage_information: Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 3 days. Reheat in the oven or microwave.
recipe.tips:
Serve with a side of salsa or guacamole.
Use different colored bell peppers for a vibrant presentation.

recipe.title: Gluten-Free Pancakes
recipe.ingredient_list:
1 cup gluten-free flour blend
1 tbsp sugar
1 tsp baking powder
1/2 tsp baking soda
1/4 tsp salt
1 cup milk
1 egg
2 tbsp melted butter
1 tsp vanilla extract
recipe.instructions:
In a bowl, whisk together gluten-free flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, and salt.
In another bowl, whisk together milk, egg, melted butter, and vanilla extract.
Pour wet ingredients into dry ingredients, stirring until just combined.
Heat a non-stick skillet over medium heat and lightly grease.
Pour 1/4 cup of batter onto the skillet for each pancake.
Cook until bubbles form on the surface, then flip and cook until golden brown.
recipe.storage_information: Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 2 days. Reheat in the toaster or microwave.
recipe.tips:
Top with fresh fruit, maple syrup, or a dollop of yogurt.
Add chocolate chips or blueberries to the batter for extra flavor.

recipe.title: Keto Chicken Alfredo
recipe.ingredient_list:
2 boneless, skinless chicken breasts, sliced
2 cups heavy cream
1 cup grated Parmesan cheese
2 cloves garlic, minced
2 tbsp butter
Salt and pepper to taste
1/4 tsp nutmeg
Chopped parsley for garnish
recipe.instructions:
In a skillet, melt butter over medium heat.
Add sliced chicken breasts and cook until browned and cooked through. Remove from skillet and set aside.
In the same skillet, add minced garlic and cook until fragrant.
Pour in heavy cream and bring to a simmer.
Stir in grated Parmesan cheese and nutmeg until smooth.
Return chicken to the skillet and coat with the Alfredo sauce.
Season with salt and pepper.
Garnish with chopped parsley before serving.
recipe.storage_information: Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 3 days. Reheat in a skillet over medium heat.
recipe.tips:
Serve over zucchini noodles or cauliflower rice for a low-carb meal.
Add steamed broccoli or spinach for extra vegetables.

recipe.title: Paleo Banana Bread
recipe.ingredient_list:
3 ripe bananas, mashed
3 eggs
1/4 cup coconut oil, melted
1/4 cup honey
1 tsp vanilla extract
2 cups almond flour
1 tsp baking soda
1/2 tsp cinnamon
1/4 tsp salt
recipe.instructions:
Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease a loaf pan.
In a bowl, mix mashed bananas, eggs, melted coconut oil, honey, and vanilla extract.
In another bowl, whisk together almond flour, baking soda, cinnamon, and salt.
Pour wet ingredients into dry ingredients, stirring until just combined.
Pour batter into the prepared loaf pan.
Bake for 50-60 minutes, until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
recipe.storage_information: Store in an airtight container at room temperature for up to 3 days, or refrigerate for up to a week.
recipe.tips:
Add chopped nuts or dark chocolate chips to the batter for extra flavor.
Serve slices with a smear of almond butter or coconut butter.

recipe.title: Vegan Lentil Soup
recipe.ingredient_list:
1 cup dried lentils
1 onion, diced
2 carrots, diced
2 celery stalks, diced
3 cloves garlic, minced
1 can diced tomatoes
4 cups vegetable broth
1 tsp cumin
1 tsp paprika
Salt and pepper to taste
Chopped parsley for garnish
recipe.instructions:
In a large pot, heat olive oil over medium heat.
Add diced onion, carrots, and celery, cooking until softened.
Stir in minced garlic, cumin, and paprika, cooking until fragrant.
Add dried lentils, diced tomatoes, and vegetable broth.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 25-30 minutes, until lentils are tender.
Season with salt and pepper.
Garnish with chopped parsley before serving.
recipe.storage_information: Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 3 days. Reheat on the stovetop or microwave.
recipe.tips:
Add a splash of lemon juice before serving for brightness.
Serve with crusty bread or over rice for a hearty meal.

recipe.title: Gluten-Free Pizza
recipe.ingredient_list:
1 gluten-free pizza crust
1/2 cup pizza sauce
1 cup shredded mozzarella cheese
1/4 cup sliced pepperoni
1/4 cup sliced bell peppers
1/4 cup sliced mushrooms
1/4 cup sliced black olives
recipe.instructions:
Preheat oven to 425°F (220°C).
Place gluten-free pizza crust on a baking sheet.
Spread pizza sauce evenly over the crust.
Sprinkle shredded mozzarella cheese on top.
Arrange sliced pepperoni, bell peppers, mushrooms, and black olives over the cheese.
Bake for 10-12 minutes, until cheese is melted and bubbly.
recipe.storage_information: Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 2 days. Reheat in the oven or microwave.
recipe.tips:
Add your favorite toppings like spinach, onions, or different cheeses.
Use a pre-made gluten-free crust for convenience.

recipe.title: Keto Salmon with Asparagus
recipe.ingredient_list:
2 salmon fillets
1 bunch asparagus, trimmed
2 tbsp olive oil
1 lemon, sliced
2 cloves garlic, minced
Salt and pepper to taste
Chopped dill for garnish
recipe.instructions:
Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Place salmon fillets and asparagus on the baking sheet.
Drizzle with olive oil and season with minced garlic, salt, and pepper.
Arrange lemon slices over the salmon and asparagus.
Bake for 15-20 minutes, until salmon is cooked through and asparagus is tender.
Garnish with chopped dill before serving.
recipe.storage_information: Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 2 days. Reheat in the oven or microwave.
recipe.tips:
Serve with a side of cauliflower rice or a green salad.
Add a sprinkle of Parmesan cheese over the asparagus for extra flavor.

recipe.title: Paleo Chicken Salad
recipe.ingredient_list:
2 cups cooked chicken, diced
1/2 cup mayonnaise
1/4 cup diced celery
1/4 cup diced red onion
1/4 cup halved grapes
1 tbsp lemon juice
Salt and pepper to taste
Chopped parsley for garnish
recipe.instructions:
In a bowl, mix diced chicken, mayonnaise, celery, red onion, grapes, and lemon juice.
Season with salt and pepper.
Garnish with chopped parsley before serving.
recipe.storage_information: Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 3 days.
recipe.tips:
Serve in lettuce wraps or on a bed of mixed greens.
Add chopped nuts or dried cranberries for extra texture and flavor.

recipe.title: Vegan Black Bean Burgers
recipe.ingredient_list:
1 can black beans, drained and rinsed
1/4 cup breadcrumbs
1/4 cup grated carrot
1/4 cup finely chopped onion
1/4 cup chopped cilantro
1 clove garlic, minced
1 tsp cumin
Salt and pepper to taste
Olive oil for frying
recipe.instructions:
In a bowl, mash black beans with a fork.
Add breadcrumbs, grated carrot, chopped onion, chopped cilantro, minced garlic, cumin, salt, and pepper, mixing until well combined.
Form mixture into patties.
Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat.
Cook patties for 3-4 minutes on each side, until golden brown.
recipe.storage_information: Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 3 days. Reheat in a skillet or microwave.
recipe.tips:
Serve on a bun with your favorite toppings.
Add a slice of avocado or vegan cheese for extra flavor.

recipe.title: Gluten-Free Blueberry Muffins
recipe.ingredient_list:
2 cups gluten-free flour blend
1/2 cup sugar
1 tbsp baking powder
1/2 tsp salt
1/2 cup milk
1/4 cup vegetable oil
1 egg
1 tsp vanilla extract
1 cup blueberries
recipe.instructions:
Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). Line a muffin tin with paper liners.
In a bowl, whisk together gluten-free flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt.
In another bowl, mix milk, vegetable oil, egg, and vanilla extract.
Pour wet ingredients into dry ingredients, stirring until just combined.
Fold in blueberries.
Divide batter evenly among muffin cups.
Bake for 20-25 minutes, until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
recipe.storage_information: Store in an airtight container at room temperature for up to 3 days.
recipe.tips:
Use fresh or frozen blueberries.
Add a sprinkle of sugar on top before baking for a crunchy top.

recipe.title: Keto Shrimp Scampi
recipe.ingredient_list:
1 lb shrimp, peeled and deveined
2 tbsp olive oil
4 cloves garlic, minced
1/4 cup chicken broth
1/4 cup white wine
2 tbsp lemon juice
1/4 cup chopped parsley
Salt and pepper to taste
Zucchini noodles for serving
recipe.instructions:
In a skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat.
Add minced garlic and cook until fragrant.
Add shrimp and cook until pink, about 2-3 minutes per side. Remove from skillet and set aside.
In the same skillet, add chicken broth, white wine, and lemon juice. Bring to a simmer.
Return shrimp to the skillet and coat with the sauce.
Season with salt and pepper.
Garnish with chopped parsley before serving over zucchini noodles.
recipe.storage_information: Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 2 days. Reheat in a skillet over medium heat.
recipe.tips:
Serve with a side of steamed vegetables or a green salad.
Add red pepper flakes for a spicy kick.

recipe.title: Paleo Cauliflower Fried Rice
recipe.ingredient_list:
1 head cauliflower, grated or riced
2 eggs, beaten
1 cup mixed vegetables (peas, carrots, bell peppers)
2 cloves garlic, minced
2 tbsp coconut aminos
1 tbsp sesame oil
2 tbsp olive oil
Salt and pepper to taste
Chopped green onions for garnish
recipe.instructions:
In a skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat.
Add grated cauliflower and cook until tender.
Push cauliflower to the side and add beaten eggs, scrambling until cooked.
Add mixed vegetables and minced garlic, cooking until vegetables are tender.
Stir in coconut aminos and sesame oil, mixing until well combined.
Season with salt and pepper.
Garnish with chopped green onions before serving.
recipe.storage_information: Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 2 days. Reheat in a skillet over medium heat.
recipe.tips:
Add cooked chicken or shrimp for a complete meal.
Use frozen mixed vegetables for convenience.

recipe.title: Vegan Tofu Stir-Fry
recipe.ingredient_list:
1 block firm tofu, cubed
2 tbsp soy sauce
1 tbsp sesame oil
1 tbsp olive oil
1 cup broccoli florets
1 cup sliced bell peppers
1/2 cup snap peas
2 cloves garlic, minced
1 tbsp grated ginger
Cooked rice for serving
recipe.instructions:
In a bowl, marinate cubed tofu with soy sauce and sesame oil.
In a skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat.
Add minced garlic and grated ginger, cooking until fragrant.
Add marinated tofu and cook until golden brown.
Add broccoli, bell peppers, and snap peas, stir-frying until vegetables are tender.
Serve over cooked rice.
recipe.storage_information: Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 2 days. Reheat in a skillet over medium heat.
recipe.tips:
Add your favorite vegetables or use a stir-fry sauce for extra flavor.
Garnish with sesame seeds or chopped green onions before serving.

recipe.title: Gluten-Free Brownies
recipe.ingredient_list:
1/2 cup butter, melted
1 cup sugar
2 eggs
1 tsp vanilla extract
1/2 cup gluten-free flour blend
1/3 cup cocoa powder
1/4 tsp salt
1/4 tsp baking powder
recipe.instructions:
Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease an 8x8 inch baking pan.
In a bowl, mix melted butter, sugar, eggs, and vanilla extract.
In another bowl, whisk together gluten-free flour, cocoa powder, salt, and baking powder.
Pour dry ingredients into wet ingredients, stirring until just combined.
Pour batter into the prepared baking pan.
Bake for 20-25 minutes, until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
recipe.storage_information: Store in an airtight container at room temperature for up to 3 days.
recipe.tips:
Add chocolate chips or nuts to the batter for extra texture.
Serve warm with a scoop of vanilla ice cream.

recipe.title: Keto Avocado Toast
recipe.ingredient_list:
1 avocado
2 slices keto bread
1 tbsp olive oil
Salt and pepper to taste
Red pepper flakes for garnish
Chopped cilantro for garnish
recipe.instructions:
Toast the keto bread slices.
Mash avocado in a bowl and season with salt and pepper.
Spread mashed avocado over the toasted bread.
Drizzle with olive oil and garnish with red pepper flakes and chopped cilantro.
recipe.storage_information: Best enjoyed immediately.
recipe.tips:
Add a poached egg or smoked salmon on top for extra protein.
Use lemon juice in the mashed avocado to prevent browning.
